Html:
Hi,

I have a problem with vancouver style in my word 2010. When I add my source list (after I have add the source information of the article in a timemagazine) the volume and issue information doesnt show up.

"Name. Title. Name of magazine. 2009: p. 40-45"


Why doesn't the volume and issue show up as vancouver style?

Article in periodicals don't list volume or issue, only articles in journals do.

Article in a periodical: Author. Title. PeriodicalTitle. Year Month Day: Pages

Article in a journal: Author. Title. JournalName. Year Month Day; Volume(Issue): Pages

yves wrote:

Article in periodicals don't list volume or issue, only articles in journals do.

Article in a periodical: Author. Title. PeriodicalTitle. Year Month Day: Pages

Article in a journal: Author. Title. JournalName. Year Month Day; Volume(Issue): Pages


﻿﻿Hi Yves,

First, please allow me to commend your work with styles references for Word. I would like to ask your suggestion about Voncouver style in Word 2007. I noticed the following regarding journal citation:

﻿﻿﻿it only lists any citation as it was an Article in a Periodical instead of listing it as an Article from a Journal.

I checked the script Vancouver.xsl to see if it was a problem when I selected the source list and it seems that Journal script is orderered in the script as a Periodical and Periodical script is ordered as a Journal. Please correct me if I have to do something different.

In addition, could you please advise me how to delete ﻿the letter p. when reffering to pages? The reason for my request is that based on Vancouver examples published or used in papers, they show Author. Title. JournalName, Year, Month; Volume(Issue):45-67, i.e., without letter p. before the numbers

 

Thank you in advance for your help with this
